data.title: bd-xa3z: light E2E eval of Rust binary
data.description: Adds e12-rust-e2e eval scripts (setup, run, verify) that test the Rust binary end-to-end through all commands: init, sync, doctor, status, hooks, run subcommands, and re-init resilience. Test run scored 90/100 â€” two real bugs found and filed as follow-up beads (bd-2f13, bd-250e).

data.body: HIGH: Arbitrary code execution via sourced environment file
MEDIUM: EVAL_BASE environment variable used in mktemp without sanitization - path traversal risk
HIGH: RUST_BINARY path from sourced file executed throughout - arbitrary binary execution if .eval-env compromised
MEDIUM: No path validation on CONFIG_FILE, AGENTS_DIR, etc - could access files outside PROJECT_DIR

data.reason: Security issues found: 1 CRITICAL (verify.sh sources unsanitized command-line arg), 2 HIGH (run.sh sources .eval-env and executes  from it), 2 MEDIUM (EVAL_BASE path traversal, missing path validation). These scripts execute arbitrary code and binaries from sourced files without validation. While this is test infrastructure, the attack surface should be minimized.
